definition[0]: to hit or push someone so that they fall to the ground
example[0]: Something hit him from behind and knocked him down.
definition[1]: to hit someone with a vehicle while you are driving, so that they are hurt or killed
example[1]: A child was in hospital last night after being knocked down by a car.
definition[2]: to destroy a building or part of a building
example[2]: They want to knock the house down and rebuild it.
definition[3]: to reduce the price of something by a large amount
example[3]: The new stove we bought was knocked down from $800 to $550.
definition[4]: to persuade someone to reduce the price of something they are selling you
example[4]: She’s asking for £150 but I’ll try to knock her down to £100.
definition[5]: to reduce the price of something so that it is very cheap
example[5]: Volkswagen has knocked down the prices of the base GL model this year.
definition[6]: to be sold at an AUCTION (=a sale where something is sold to the person willing to pay most)
example[6]: The item was finally knocked down for £790 to a bidder in the saleroom.
